H0.text: Thyroid is the gland controlled by a negative feedback loop that includes the hypothalamus and pituitary gland.

H1.text: Stomach is the gland controlled by a negative feedback loop that includes the hypothalamus and pituitary gland.

H2.text: The adrenal gland is regulated by a negative feedback loop that includes the hypothalamus and pituitary gland.

H3.text: Pituitary is the gland controlled by a negative feedback loop that includes the hypothalamus and the pituitary gland.

A4.text: The HPA axis is an example of a negative feedback system, in which cortisol itself acts as a direct inhibitor of both CRH and ACTH synthesis.

A5.text: Glucocorticoid synthesis is stimulated by adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone released into the bloodstream by the anterior pituitary.
